summary: This is an email exchange between a Senior Financial Investigator and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding outstanding subpoena returns for the Epstein investigation. The subpoenas target corporate records from New York, the U.S. Virgin Islands, and Delaware, specifically for entities like LSJ LLC, and attachments include records for Nine East 71, Laurel Inc., and Maple Inc.

persons.name: Will
persons.context: Paralegal for the U.S. Attorney's office who can set up a file-sharing portal for transferring large subpoena returns.

events.title: Subpoena to Albany Division of Corporations
events.description: A subpoena was served on the Albany Division of Corporations for records related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Second Subpoena to USVI Corporations and Trademarks
events.description: A second subpoena was served on the U.S. Virgin Islands Corporations and Trademarks office for records related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Subpoena to Delaware Division of Corporations
events.description: A subpoena was served on the Delaware Division of Corporations for records related to the Epstein investigation, specifically for LSJ LLC.

locations: U.S. Virgin Islands (USVI) Corporations and Trademarks
State of Delaware, Division of Corporations
keyFacts: The investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was actively pursuing corporate records via subpoenas as of June 2020.
Subpoenas targeted corporate divisions in New York, the U.S. Virgin Islands, and Delaware, indicating a focus on Epstein's business entities and holdings.
Specific entities of interest include LSJ LLC, and attached records reference 'Nine East 71', 'Laurel Inc.', and 'Maple Inc.'.
The correspondence shows coordination between a Senior Financial Investigator and the U.S. Attorney's Office to obtain outstanding subpoena returns.
